claim: Facebook analyzes everything you type even (especially) when you don't commit to the post or message.
title: 71% of Facebook Users Engage in 'Self-Censorship'
author: Alexis C. Madrigal
tldr: Facebook conducted a study on 3.9 million users to measure how many people typed more than five characters into Facebook content-input boxes, but then did not post them.
reasons: Facebook is part of the "attention economy", they make more money the more time you spend on their platform. For this reason the algorithm they use to generate your feed is designed to keep you engaged and generating data. What Facebook calls "self-censorship" is arguably the type of behavior they want to discourage, knowing that they record and analyze this is a reminder of the lengths to which Facebook goes to understand and in turn influence our choices.
